Title: RAG-FM
Description: RAG-FM “ Top Music Top of the Dial ” is a LPFM radio station broadcasting on the westerly air waves, Snuggled in the heart of Raglan on the West Coast of the North Island in New Zealand. Playing heaps of Rock ‘n’ Roll, Classic Rock, even all those great Oldies we all know & sing along to ! Do you remember the 60’s Surf Music, well we still play it. We even play the old Doo-Wop Music. Also Country – old – new, revamped, plus specialising in the unique sounds that are home grown New Zealand Music Kiwi through ‘n’ through – where? “ 107.7 FM Top of the Dial ” A sample of all genres to please the most discerning taste, young & old alike can rock to RAG-FM 107.7

Title: Nga Iwi FM
Description: To Empower The Voice of Hauraki and hear it in all its beauty throughout all of its Tribal Regions. Ko te Reo o Hauraki -  Nga Iwi FM, was started back in the day and is going from strength to strength. Yep, we're here to broadcast loud and proud out of New Zealand's number one community-Paeroa.You can rely on us to blaze out the hottest hip hop, Rnb and a healthy dose of Tikanga Maori to our people of  Pare Hauraki! Hecka, with Live streaming over the internet we can even entertain the whanau worldwide from Paris to Parihaka. What started as a dream remains to be YOUR station Whanau, and you know what - we wouldnt have it any other way!

Title: Tumeke FM 96.9

It went to air as Tumeke FM on 6 April 1991, became Sun FM in 1994 to increase its advertising appeal, and between 1996 and 1999 worked to increase its Māori language content. The classic hits station broadcasts on 96.9 FM in Whakatane (Wikipedia)

Title: Power Hit FM 87.8 - Christchurch, NZ
Description: Power Hit FM (formally Power Hit Radio) is a Low Powered FM (LPFM) Radio Station broadcasting on 87.8 FM in one of many suburbs in Christchurch, New Zealand called St Albans/Mairehau and can be also heard globally on the Internet at www.powerhitfm.co.nz.  Power Hit FM aims to be community focus and is set up as a non-commercial hobby radio station broadcasting Local Information, Community Notices, Weather, News and Sports with Local and International Entertainment.  Power Hit FM is licensed with OneMusic (APRA & PPNZ Music License) for music broadcasting rights and also follows the LFPM, ASA & BSA laws in New Zealand.  Power Hit FM started broadcasting on the 5th December 2005.  Follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/powerhitfm  Less Talk, More Music – Playing All The Hits, All The Time.

Title: Mushroom FM
Description: We're going to start with the last bit, the FM, first, because we're just weird like that. This is an Internet only radio station, so why the bleep do we have FM at the end of our name, eh? Why? FM, on the old-fashioned radio, refers to the band, and normally stands for frequency modulation. But that's not what the FM stands for in our case. See? It never pays to assume. It could stand for "flaming marvellous". We may have concluded that it stands for "ferocious monsters". But actually, it stands for "fantastic music", because that's part of the Mushroom FM guarantee you see.

Title: Plains FM 96.9

Description: https://www.facebook.com/RadioHauraki https://twitter.com/RadioHaurakiNZ Radio Hauraki is a New Zealand rock music station that started in 1966.. It was the first private commercial radio station of the modern broadcasting era in New Zealand and operated illegally until 1970 to break the monopoly held by the state-owned New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation. From its founding until 2012 Hauraki played a mix of classic and mainstream rock music. In 2013
